metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: To draw a line in canvas, we use the following methods:
content.html: To draw a line in canvas, we use the following methods:

content.code:
<script>// Create a Canvas:
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

// Define a new path
ctx.beginPath();

// Set a start-point
ctx.moveTo(0, 0);

// Set an end-point
ctx.lineTo(200, 100);

// Stroke it (Do the Drawing)
ctx.stroke();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
// Create a Canvas:
 const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

// Define a new path
 ctx.beginPath();

// Set a start-point
 ctx.moveTo(0, 0);

// Set an end-point
 ctx.lineTo(200, 100);

// Stroke it (Do the Drawing)
 ctx.stroke();
</script>

content.text: The lineWidth property defines the width of the line.
content.html: The lineWidth property defines the width of the line.

content.text: It must be set before calling the stroke() method.
content.html: It must be set before calling the stroke() method.

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");
ctx.beginPath();
ctx.moveTo(0, 0);
ctx.lineTo(200, 100);
ctx.lineWidth = 10;
ctx.stroke();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.moveTo(0, 0);
ctx.lineTo(200, 100);
ctx.lineWidth = 10;
ctx.stroke();
</script>

content.text: The strokeStyle property defines the color of the line.
content.html: The strokeStyle property defines the color of the line.

content.text: It must be set before calling the stroke() method.
content.html: It must be set before calling the stroke() method.

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");
ctx.beginPath();
ctx.moveTo(0, 0);
ctx.lineTo(200, 100);
ctx.lineWidth = 10;
ctx.strokeStyle = "red";
ctx.stroke();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.moveTo(0, 0);
ctx.lineTo(200, 100);
ctx.lineWidth = 10;
ctx.strokeStyle = "red";
ctx.stroke();
</script>

content.text: The lineCap property defines the cap style of the line ("butt", "round" or "square").
content.html: The lineCap property defines the cap style of the line ("butt", "round" or "square").

content.text: It must be set before calling the stroke() method.
content.html: It must be set before calling the stroke() method.

content.code:
<script>const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");
ctx.beginPath();
ctx.moveTo(0,0);
ctx.lineTo(175,75);
ctx.lineWidth = 10;
ctx.lineCap = "round";
ctx.stroke();</script>
content.code_html:
<script>
const canvas = document.getElementById("myCanvas");
const ctx = canvas.getContext("2d");

ctx.beginPath();
ctx.moveTo(0,0);
ctx.lineTo(175,75);
ctx.lineWidth = 10;
ctx.lineCap = "round";
ctx.stroke();
</script>
